snippet: Mr. Stern was a combat cameraman in World War II, and also captured intimate photographs of Sinatra, Bogart, Brando and Monroe, as well as the new President Kennedy.
abstract: Phil Stern, celebrated photographer whose images caught horrors of war, bittersweet joys of Pres John F Kennedy's inaugural ball and intimate moments of jazz greats and Hollywood stars, dies at age 95.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Stern was a combat cameraman in World War II, and also captured intimate photographs of Sinatra, Bogart, Brando and Monroe, as well as the new President Kennedy.

headline.main: Phil Stern, 95, Dies; Photographed War, Movie Stars and a President
headline.print_headline: Phil Stern, Photographer; Chronicler of Movie Stars And a President Was 95
